newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine Central Bank overnight rates unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Philippine Central Bank overnight rates unchanged.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Friday it had left its overnight borrowing and lending rates unchanged.
The borrowing rate was maintained at 10.50 percent and the lending rate was steady at 13 percent.
On Thursday, treasurer Sergio Edeza told Reuters the central bank would not hesitate to take drastic steps if the peso continued to be battered.
The normally placid Philippine foreign exchange market was pushed into pandemonium in late trade on Thursday on false rumours that Defence Secretary Renato de Villa had been killed in an ambush.
"We'll use it (the interest rate) if necessary. We'll just have to wait. I believe it (peso) has calmed down actually," he said.
